recipe.title: Butterflied Paprika Chicken
recipe.description: A smoky, paprika-rubbed butterflied chicken cooked over indirect heat, served with cheesy corn, sweet potato wedges, homemade peri peri sauce and a fresh herb slaw.

ingredients.name: corn on the cob with husks

steps.instructions: Soak the corn (husks and all) in cold water for at least 30 minutes. Soak 2 handfuls of woodchips in water for 30 minutes.

on_enter.say: Start by soaking the corn and woodchips for 30 minutes.

steps.instructions: Drain the woodchips, transfer to the smoker box and place on the left-hand side of the barbecue. Prepare the barbecue for indirect cooking at 190–230°C and preheat for 15 minutes, until smoking.

on_enter.say: Let’s get the barbecue hot and ready for indirect heat cooking.

steps.instructions: Mix 1 heaped teaspoon each of smoked paprika and dried oregano with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and 1 tablespoon of red wine vinegar to form a paste. Using a sharp knife, cut down the backbone of the chicken and open it out. Rub the paste all over the chicken, especially into the nooks and crannies. Place it skin-side up in the indirect zone of the barbecue.

steps.descr: Char chillies, garlic, onion and tomatoes
steps.instructions: Prick the chillies and place them with the unpeeled garlic on the warming rack. Place the unpeeled onion and tomatoes on the direct heat next to the chicken. Grill with the lid down for 10–15 minutes, until charred and soft, removing each item once done.

on_enter.say: Place the chillies, garlic, onion, and tomatoes on the barbecue to char and soften.

steps.descr: Cook sweet potato wedges and corn; finish chicken
steps.instructions: Scrub and quarter the sweet potatoes, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, season, and place on the warming rack. Drain the corn and place it on the direct heat. Cook with the lid down for 30 minutes, or until the husks are blackened, the sweet potato is soft, and the chicken is crispy and cooked through. Remove everything to a board.

on_enter.say: Now cook the sweet potatoes and corn while the chicken finishes cooking.

steps.instructions: Once cool enough to handle, peel and quarter the onion, peel the garlic, deseed the chillies, and optionally peel off the blackened skins. Blend with the remaining teaspoon of paprika and oregano, honey, 3 tablespoons of olive oil and 2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar until smooth. Season to perfection and transfer to a serving bowl.

Scrub the carrots, peel the red onion, and core the apple. Finely shred them with the red cabbage. In a jam jar, shake together mustard, apple cider vinegar and 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil. Season and pour into a bowl, add most of the herbs, then toss the veg in the dressing.

steps.descr: Butter the corn and coat with halloumi
steps.instructions: Dot the butter on a barbecue-safe tray and place on the barbecue to melt. Grate in lime zest and squeeze the juice. Finely grate the halloumi. Peel back the corn husks but keep them intact. Roll each cob in the lime butter, then in the grated halloumi.
Carve the chicken and arrange on a platter. Scatter over the remaining herbs. Serve with cheesy corn, sweet potato wedges, slaw and peri peri sauce.

notes.barbecue_tip: Indirect heat ensures even cooking without burning the marinade. Lid-down cooking is essential for smoke circulation.
